intro: Herpestis radicata, commonly known as the redroot sandparsley, is a member of the Apiaceae family and is native to the arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing perennial herb with a fibrous root system that gives it its common name. The plant features slender, branched stems and small, fern-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are clustered in umbels and are typically greenish-yellow in color. Herpestis radicata is adapted to harsh environments and is often found in sandy or gravelly soils.
